channel.title: Comments on: If bf2042 allows this then its an auto delete from me. This game had a tier stacking of 2 squads or 8 people.
channel.description: Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War is a first-person shooter video game developed by Treyarch and Raven Software and published by Activision. r/BlackOpsColdWar is a developer-recognized community focused on the title.

item.title: By: karottendealer
item.dc:creator: karottendealer
item.description: Thats literally what Battlefield is made for. Strategic Gameplay with big Teams and SQUADS!!!!
item.content:encoded: Thats literally what Battlefield is made for. Strategic Gameplay with big Teams and SQUADS!!!!

item.title: By: Maddogs2431
item.dc:creator: Maddogs2431
item.description: What the stacks also do is ruin the game for new players. Everyone wants this franchise to prosper but when some casual runs into 8 man stacks and goes 4-19 what’s his motivation to get good as some would say. One squad running around cool 8 that’s bad for gameplay.
item.content:encoded: What the stacks also do is ruin the game for new players. Everyone wants this franchise to prosper but when some casual runs into 8 man stacks and goes 4-19 what’s his motivation to get good as some would say. One squad running around cool 8 that’s bad for gameplay.

item.title: By: HerHymn
item.dc:creator: HerHymn
item.description: Alex is the man of my nightmares on Iwo jima
item.content:encoded: Alex is the man of my nightmares on Iwo jima

item.title: By: Xb-Dashie-dX
item.dc:creator: Xb-Dashie-dX
item.description:
I get why people hate clans but c’mon guys, is it really bad for people to want to play with their friends at all?
And if that clan tag wasn’t there, but they were 4 skilled players anyways that played together because they were friends, would you not complain just because they don’t have something visually saying “hey we play together”?
item.content:encoded:
I get why people hate clans but c’mon guys, is it really bad for people to want to play with their friends at all?

And if that clan tag wasn’t there, but they were 4 skilled players anyways that played together because they were friends, would you not complain just because they don’t have something visually saying “hey we play together”?

item.title: By: Valen_1138
item.dc:creator: Valen_1138
item.description: Clans ruin public servers in this game. What’s the fun in playing by myself or with a friend against 5+ coordinated high skill players all communicating and running together?
item.content:encoded: Clans ruin public servers in this game. What’s the fun in playing by myself or with a friend against 5+ coordinated high skill players all communicating and running together?

item.title: By: a7omb0mb
item.dc:creator: a7omb0mb
item.description: It doesn't matter. You'll have already bought the game and Dice will be walking away with their wheelbarrow full of money before you can say "stacked team"
item.content:encoded: It doesn’t matter. You’ll have already bought the game and Dice will be walking away with their wheelbarrow full of money before you can say “stacked team”

item.title: By: circa-xciv
item.dc:creator: circa-xciv
item.description:
I don't want to be rude, clan stacks can get frustrating but playing without friends in this game is just not fun. The average player is not reliable any more. Not every game has to be sweaty but when your teammates don't even try to play the objective, revive, supply etc then what is the point.
Chances of getting into a decent squad, let alone a good squad are so low it hurts. Battlefield has always been a communication game, especially in the last decade. Now the average, casual player just doesn't bother. Even casual players back in the day would still communicate with randoms, its how you made friends. You can say you do these things, PTFO and all but if you play this game enough its simply not true. Games that go ticket for ticket are far and less between games that finish 500-0. "Clans" aren't going anywhere and with 128 players, a party of 8 won't even have as much as an impact.
item.content:encoded:
I don’t want to be rude, clan stacks can get frustrating but playing without friends in this game is just not fun. The average player is not reliable any more. Not every game has to be sweaty but when your teammates don’t even try to play the objective, revive, supply etc then what is the point.

Chances of getting into a decent squad, let alone a good squad are so low it hurts. Battlefield has always been a communication game, especially in the last decade. Now the average, casual player just doesn’t bother. Even casual players back in the day would still communicate with randoms, its how you made friends. You can say you do these things, PTFO and all but if you play this game enough its simply not true. Games that go ticket for ticket are far and less between games that finish 500-0. “Clans” aren’t going anywhere and with 128 players, a party of 8 won’t even have as much as an impact.

item.title: By: marcobe2
item.dc:creator: marcobe2
item.description: “If the game allows a large group of friends to play together it’s an auto delete for me” Moron.
item.content:encoded: “If the game allows a large group of friends to play together it’s an auto delete for me” Moron.
